business.headline: Understanding GST on used cars: Rules, examples, and exemptionsThe GST Council clarified rules for old vehicle sales, setting an 18 per cent tax on seller margins, exempting private sales and negative margins, and simplifying taxation for used and electric vehicles, ensuring fair application of GST across transactions.

Economy rebounds in Q3 with boost from festivals and rural demand: RBIAn article on the 'State of the Economy' in the December bulletin noted that the global economy continues to exhibit resilience with steady growth and moderating inflation.
Sensex, Nifty close lower in a choppy session; IT and metal stocks weighThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 67.30 points to close at 78,472.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 23.35 points to end at 23,730.10.

18% GST on used cars: Do you have to pay tax on selling your car?The decision has sparked debates as it comes at a time when India's used car market is poised for growth. Many believe the move aims to tap into the rapidly expanding sector to boost government revenue.
Tata Capital IPO buzz? All you need to knowIf the IPO goes through, it will be the Tata Group's second public offering in two decades. The last one was Tata Technologies' IPO in November last year.

Apple nears $4 trillion valuation amid AI push and iPhone upgrade hopesApple's strategic push into AI and its resilience in navigating market challenges have positioned the tech giant as a leader in the sector.
Greaves Cotton share price gains over 10% today. What's behind the rally? Greaves Cotton stock price: The company's shares were trading 10.25% higher at Rs 252.70 on the BSE at 12:18 pm.

Explained: Why Tata Investment share price jumped 12% todayTata Investment stock price: At 11:53 am, shares of the company were up 11.51% to Rs 7,284 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The surge followed reports that Tata Capital is gearing up for an initial public offering (IPO) worth Rs 15,000 crore.

Are stock markets closed on December 25? Check the full 2025 holiday scheduleOn regular weekdays, the stock market operates from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM. A pre-opening session takes place from 9:00 AM to 9:15 AM to set the tone for the trading day.

Which insurance companies reject claims the least? Report reveals truthPeople don't just put in money but trust when they buy insurance policies to cover for medical emergencies or motor accidents. A report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India reveals how many such claims have been accepted or rejected by insurance companies in 2022-23.

Carraro India IPO: Check GMP, price band and subscription statusCarraro India IPO is a Rs 1,250 crore offer for sale (OFS) consisting of 1.77 crore shares. As this is a pure OFS, the entire proceeds will go to the selling shareholders, and the company will not raise fresh capital.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Latest subscription status, GMP; listing dateSenores Pharmaceuticals IPO: The IPO comprises a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 500 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 21,00,000 equity shares by promoters and existing shareholders.

Sagility India share price rises 5% to hit upper circuit today. Here's why Sagility India debuted on the stock market with an issue price of Rs 30 per share. At its current level, the stock has surged over 63% from the IPO price, underscoring strong investor interest.

Ventive Hospitality IPO: Check GMP as listing enters last day for biddingRetail investors must apply for a minimum of 23 shares per lot, which requires a minimum investment of Rs 14,789 for retail applicants.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as market rally loses steam; TCS gains 1% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 47.25 points to 78,587.42, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 10.80 points to 23,764.25 as of 9:30 AM.

DAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusDAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment: The allotment status can be checked by investors through the websites of either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) or Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing date Mamata Machinery IPO allotment: Investors who have bid can check their allotment status online by logging in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Stocks to watch today: Wipro, Vedanta, Adani Enterprises, TVS Motor Several companies are expected to remain in focus due to recent developments. Among them are Vedanta, Prestige Estates, Wipro, Adani Enterprises, and TVS Motor.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Ex-bureaucrat Ajay Bhalla appointed Manipur Governor, Arif Khan moved to BiharAjay Kumar Bhalla will replace Lakshman Prasad Acharya, who assumed the office on July 31 this year, as Manipur Governor.

5 soldiers dead after Army vehicle plunges into 350-foot gorge in J&K's PoonchA vehicle carrying 10 Army personnel lost control and fell into a 350-feet-deep gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district, leaving five soldiers dead and many others injured.

Champions Trophy: India vs Pakistan on February 23 as ICC announces full scheduleChampions Trophy: The ICC announced the full schedule of the Champions Trophy on Tuesday, December 24. The India vs Pakistan group stage game is set to be played on February 23. In case India qualify for the final, the match will be played in Dubai.

Congress releases 2nd list for Delhi polls, two AAP turncoats get ticketsThe Congress party fielded two AAP turncoats, Asim Ahmed Khan and Devinder Sehrawat from Matia Mahal and Bijwasan seats, respectively, for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections.

Pics: Shimla transforms into white wonderland, tourists enjoy fresh snowfallNestled in the serene hills of Himachal Pradesh, Shimla has turned into a postcard-perfect destination following the recent snowfall. Blanketed in pristine white, the Queen of Hills has come alive with the joy of tourists savouring the chill, walking on the white snow, and sipping hot tea amidst the picturesque landscapes. From Mall Road to Kufri, every corner is a visual delight. This photo gallery captures the essence of Shimla's snowy charm and the smiles it has brought to all.

Allu Arjun questioned for 4 hours, said knew about death next day: SourcesAllu Arjun was questioned by the Hyderabad Police for four hours over the death of a 36-year-old woman in a stampede at Sandhya theatre during Pushpa 2's premiere on December 4.

Manu Bhaker breaks silence on Khel Ratna snub: Believe there's been a lapseManu Bhaker remained undeterred despite being left out of the Khel Ratna nominations. The shooter emphasised her commitment to winning medals for India, stating that while awards motivate her, they are not the ultimate goal of her journey.

8-year-old girl found dead in Army quarters in Delhi, teen arrested for murderAn eight-year-old girl was found murdered in Delhi's Army cantonment after being allegedly strangled by her 19-year-old neighbour. The accused was arrested within hours of committing the crime.

Beef crisis in Goa this Christmas as Quraishi traders go on strike over cow vigilantesGoa is facing a beef supply crisis this Christmas due to a strike by traders over the alleged rise in instances of cow vigilantism. The Quraishi Meat Traders Association began the protest on December 23, timing it with Christmas. It has vowed to continue the strike until the government guarantees the safety of traders.

'Bengaluru is Bengaluru because...': Woman's 'North Indian' remark sparks debateA video of a woman claiming that 'Bengaluru is Bengaluru because of North Indians' has gone viral on social media, sparking a fierce debate.

Alcohol khatam, farsaan baaki: Did Gujarat-Thailand flyers hit booze limit?People on the first Air India flight from Surat to Bangkok claimed that they had polished off the entire alcohol stock on the plane. Air India Express officials refuted the claim, saying it was well-stocked. Did the passengers hit an unofficial limit on alcohol servings? Who takes such a call mid-air?

Vinod Kambli develops fever in hospital, condition stableVinod Kambli, battling a severe urinary infection and brain clots, is stable in ICU. Rain lashes parts of Delhi on Christmas Eve, temperature dips below 10 degreesLight rain and cold waves gripped Delhi and its adjoining areas on Tuesday evening, with temperatures dropping to 9.9 degrees.

I would drink all night: Aamir Khan reflects on his bad habitsAamir Khan, in a candid conversation with Nana Patekar, revealed his struggles with indiscipline and bad habits but shared how filmmaking keeps him grounded. He plans to release one film every year to stay disciplined.

Christmas travel scare in US as American Airlines briefly grounds all flightsAmerican Airlines posted on X that they are trying to fix the problem as soon as possible, but they cannot give a timeframe as to how long it exactly would take them to restore services.

Bangladesh frees ex-minister who funded POK terrorists to bleed IndiaA Bangladesh court has freed former BNP minister Abdus Salam Pintu who helped in the recruitment and training of terrorists from Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (POK). Pintu was in jail for 17 years after being convicted in the 2004 plot to assassinate Sheikh Hasina. He helped terror outfit HuJI with funds to procure arms and train recruits.

Watch: Vinod Kambli sings from hospital bed, shares positive health updateFormer India cricketer Vinod Kambli appeared emotional as he spoke to the media from a private hospital in Thane on Tuesday. The member of 1996 World Cup team was hospitalised on Saturday after his health deteriorated.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
